newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Portuguese shares recover from lows, focus on EDP.
newsitem.headline: Portuguese shares recover from lows, focus on EDP.

text.p: Portuguese shares recovered from the lows, ending a quiet session in which many investors took profits to raise cash for the forthcoming privatisation of EDP-Electricidade de Portugal. News that EDP had suspended talks on the possibility of acquiring a 20 percent stake in mobile phone operator Telecel weighed on Telecel shares, which ended down two percent or 290 escudos to 13,700 in volume of 135,642 after falling as much as seven percent. Telecel accounted for 26 percent of the turnover on Lisbon bourse of 7.2 billion escudos. Operators said they expected a calm session on Monday due to holidays in the United States and Britain. "I think there will probably be be a dull session on Lisbon bourse on Monday," said one.
